Description: Terracotta lamp made in a mould. Applied vertical band-handle. Discus decorated with obscure relief decorations (pointed leaves? etc.). Shoulder has a row of ring-and-dot patterns and leaves. Undefined base. Pink clay with mica covered with a red slip.
Curator's comments: Same Series: Hayes, J.W., 1980. ‘Ancient lamps in the Royal Ontario Museum’. Toronto : Royal Ontario Museum, 495. Close: Säve-Söderbergh, T., 1981. ‘Late Nubian cemeteries’. New York : Scandinavian University Books, pl. 15, 2, from Serra near Faras, dated AD 500-750. Near: Guerrini, L., 1974. In: S. Donadoni ‘et. Al’ (eds.). ‘Antinoe (1965-1968): missione archeologica in Egitto dell' Università di Roma’. Rome : Istituto di studi del Vicino Oriente, pl. 39, 16, from Antinoe; Junker, H., 1925. ‘Ermenne : Bericht über die grabungen der Akademie der wissenschaften in Wien auf den friedhöfen von Ermenne (Nubien) im winter 1911/12’. Vienna : Hölder-Pichler-Tempsky, pl. xiv, 155; Woolley, C.L., 1911. ‘Karanòg’. Philadelphia : University Museum, pl. 13.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (2215)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 4/44/1 (Excavation No. (but this appears to be an error).)
